input module¶

The input module reads the input .xml file and creates an Input instance holding the values from the .xml file as well as a layers array that for each layer holds information about each layer such as the material with its properties as well as the grid.

class input.Input(xmlfile)¶

Bases: object

reads the input xml file and stores the information

Parameters

xmlfile (str) – path to xml file

class input.Layer(layerelem, root)¶

Bases: object

creates a Layer objects that holds various information about the TPS layer

Parameters

  • layerelem (xml.etree.ElementTree.Element) – layer element from xml tree

  • root (xml.etree.ElementTree.Element) – xml root element

input.find_existing(name, kind=None)¶

tries to find existing file or directory in a number of default directories; these are (in the following order):

  • in the absolute path (<file>)

  • in the current working directory (pwd/<file>)

  • in the directory specified by the Hot-STARSHIP environment variable ($HOTSTARSHIP_DIR/<file>)

  • optional: in the directory specified by the Hot-STARSHIP environment variable plus the standard directory for this type, e.g. material: ($HOTSTARSHIP_DIR/Data/Materials/<file>)

  • optional: for a material with .matp ending in the directory specified by the Hot-STARSHIP environment variable plus the standard material directory plus the directory with .matp removed from the name (for <file>.matp in $HOTSTARSHIP_DIR/Data/Materials/<file>/<file>.matp)

If the file or directory cannot be located, an error will be raised.

Parameters

  • name (str) – path to find

  • kind (str) – specifies kind of directory to look out for, important for 4 and 5 (Default value = None)

Returns

path to existing file

Return type

Path

input.readMaterial(matname, ablative, corrugated, ablative_vals=None, corrugated_vals=None)¶

checks whether there is an existing material properties file with the right settings, if not, it initiates the material creation with the according parameters

Parameters

  • matname (Path) – path to material file

  • ablative (bool) – ablative material flag

  • corrugated (bool) – corrugated material flag

  • ablative_vals (dict) – ablative material information (pressure, atmosphere, etc.) (Default value = None)

  • corrugated_vals (dict) – corrugated material information (geometry) (Default value = None)

Returns

created or read material

Return type

material.Material
